metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: With the new way of drawing components, explained in the Game Rotation chapter, the movements are more flexible.
content.html: With the new way of drawing components, explained in the Game Rotation chapter, the movements are more flexible.

content.text: Add a speed property to the component constructor, which represents the current speed of the component.
content.html: Add a speed property to the component constructor, which represents the current speed of the component.

content.text: Also make some changes in the newPos() method, to calculate the position of the component, based on speed and angle .
content.html: Also make some changes in the newPos() method, to calculate the position of the component, based on speed and angle.

content.text: By default, the components are facing up, and by setting the speed property to 1, the component will start moving forward.
content.html: By default, the components are facing up, and by setting the speed property to 1, the component will start moving forward.

content.code_html:
function component(width, height, color, x, y) {
  this.gamearea = gamearea;
  this.width = width;
  this.height = height;
  this.angle = 0;
  this.speed = 1;
  this.x = x;
  this.y = y;
  this.update = function() {
    ctx = myGameArea.context;
    ctx.save();
    ctx.translate(this.x, this.y);
    ctx.rotate(this.angle);
    ctx.fillStyle = color;
    ctx.fillRect(this.width / -2, this.height / -2, this.width, this.height);
    ctx.restore();
  }
  this.newPos = function() {
    this.x += this.speed * Math.sin(this.angle);
    this.y -= this.speed * Math.cos(this.angle);
  }
}

content.text: We also want to be able to make left and right turns. Make a new property called moveAngle , which indicates the current moving value, or rotation angle. In the newPos() method calculate the angle based on the moveAngle property:
content.html: We also want to be able to make left and right turns. Make a new property called moveAngle, which indicates the current moving value, or rotation angle. In the newPos() method calculate the angle based on the moveAngle property:

content.code_html:
function component(width, height, color, x, y) {
  this.width = width;
  this.height = height;
  this.angle = 0;
  this.moveAngle = 1;
  this.speed = 1;
  this.x = x;
  this.y = y;
  this.update = function() {
    ctx = myGameArea.context;
    ctx.save();
    ctx.translate(this.x, this.y);
    ctx.rotate(this.angle);
    ctx.fillStyle = color;
    ctx.fillRect(this.width / -2, this.height / -2, this.width, this.height);
    ctx.restore();
  }
  this.newPos = function() {
    this.angle += this.moveAngle * Math.PI / 180;
     this.x += this.speed * Math.sin(this.angle);
    this.y -= this.speed * Math.cos(this.angle);
  }
}

content.text: How does the red square move when using the keyboard? Instead of moving up and down, and from side to side, the red square moves forward when you use the "up" arrow, and turns left and right when pressing the left and right arrows.
content.html: How does the red square move when using the keyboard? Instead of moving up and down, and from side to side, the red square moves forward when you use the "up" arrow, and turns left and right when pressing the left and right arrows.
